title: TiddlyWiki vs Standard Notes for Power users
meta_description: TiddlyWiki vs Standard Notes for power users building a portable, highly customizable knowledge archive in one file.
constraint_lens: You want a system that scales in customization, structure, and control without hitting hard limits.

verdict.summary: TiddlyWiki wins for power users who want a self-contained and deeply customizable knowledge archive. It runs as a single HTML file that stores content, structure, and custom behavior together. Standard Notes supports extensions, but customization is constrained by its editor and extension model. If extension-based customization is structurally limited, Standard Notes fails first.
verdict.decision_rule: If extension-based customization is structurally limited, Standard Notes fails first.

sections.heading: Best fit for maximum control and portability
sections.content: You want one portable file that contains your entire system. TiddlyWiki stores notes, layout, and custom logic inside a single HTML file you can move anywhere. Standard Notes separates notes from extensions and depends on its app framework for behavior.

bullets.why_it_matters: All notes and customizations live in one portable file. You can copy or back it up without exporting multiple folders.
You can create custom views, templates, and behaviors directly inside the wiki. This allows structural changes beyond simple editor extensions.
You can embed one note inside another and build dynamic pages. This supports complex knowledge structures.
Your archive is protected without building custom security layers.

bullets.point: Extension system for editors and features
bullets.why_it_matters: You can add editors like rich text or markdown, but the system remains inside defined extension boundaries.
Notes sync automatically without managing files manually.

sections.heading: Where each tool can break down

items.fails_when: You prefer a polished app with automatic syncing and minimal manual file handling.
items.what_to_do_instead: Use Standard Notes if you want encryption and account-based sync without managing a file.

items.fails_when: You want to redesign the system itself or embed custom logic beyond available extensions.
items.what_to_do_instead: Switch to TiddlyWiki for full structural control.

sections.heading: When this verdict might flip
sections.content: If security and automatic sync matter more than structural freedom, Standard Notes may feel more practical despite its limits.

sections.heading: Quick rules
rules: If you want one portable file with deep customization, choose TiddlyWiki.
If you prefer encrypted notes with built-in sync, consider Standard Notes.
If structural limits frustrate you, avoid extension-bound systems.

faqs.a: Yes. It can run as a single HTML file containing notes and custom logic.
Yes, through extensions, but changes remain within the extension framework.

faqs.q: Which has the higher ceiling for customization?
faqs.a: TiddlyWiki generally has the higher ceiling because you can modify its structure directly.

faqs.q: Which is easier to sync across devices?
faqs.a: Standard Notes is easier because it handles sync through its account system.
